next up on this list of the best
baseball movies is the 2013 jackie
robinson biopic 42. the film was written
and directed by brian helgeland who won
an oscar for writing la confidential and
tells the story of jackie robinson the
first black athlete to play in major
league baseball during the modern era
the late chadwick boseman stars as
robinson and harrison ford plays branch
rickey defied major league baseball's
infamous color barrier by signing
robinson but this put both men in the
line of fire with the public the press
and the rest of the league with racism
coming from all sides and 42 shows the
true courage that jackie robinson had to
restrain himself and let his amazing
talent on the field do the talking
instead

washington rumored to star but that

got 42. it would end up being a career
altering performance from chadwick
boseman who sadly passed away in 2020.
